channel.title: Are you cheap?
channel.description:
This is a conversation a friend and I had the other day. We were pretty much talking about how I can be "cheap" sometimes and we got to making fun of some of the moments. Feel free to share some of your own "cheap" moments.
Below are true stories from me :D
1. You are cheap when you scratch out "Happy Halloween" on a stuffed animal and write in pink "Happy Valentines Day" < -- funny stuffs I know xD
2. You know you are cheap when you shred paper just to make a free puzzle.
3. You know you are cheap when you use a napkin instead of a coffee filter. < -- more of a thing I learned from my family but whatever.
4. You know you are cheap when you would rather get the crappy $1.99 bag of chips over the $3.99 bag.

item.title: Are you cheap?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:72, topic:432471”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=535181.msg3913627#msg3913627 date=1328987648]

Had to remember this community average age is 13. When you make your own money you tend to think twice.

Average age of the community is probably 17… Scroll down and see how old a lot of people are turning. Most are turning 18 or 19…

people lie about their age

People also tell the truth about their age. Idk, the average age is definitively not 13.

i agree with you.
if we where all 13, we would be designing servers where D-Claws have +9999999 for all the stats, and every server here would be leeched.
[/quote]the thing is… 90% of the servers are either leeched or infected.[/quote]
but not 100%, haha. 9/10 is better than 10/10. there is still hope.

Read full topic

item.title: Are you cheap?
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:48, topic:432471”][quote author=SETO link=topic=535181.msg3913152#msg3913152 date=1328934555]
you know when you are cheap when you use Linux

i usually don’t by name brands, at most i could get the same product, if not better for almost .5 the cost
[/quote]to be fair linux > windows any day[/quote]
true yet, if you are a average user windows is much better for you than Linux, i been using Linux (Red hat) for about 6 years now, thats where all my course work and programming are done. At the end of the day when i am using the computer casually i hop over to windows.
